left.name: specimen_type
left.description: Description of the kind of specimen that was collected with respect to tumour/normal tissue origin.

codeList: Cell line - derived from xenograft tumour
Metastatic tumour - metastasis local to lymph node
Metastatic tumour - metastasis to distant location
Normal - tissue adjacent to primary tumour
Xenograft - derived from tumour cell line

right.name: specimen_type
right.description: Description of the kind of specimen that was collected with respect to tumour/normal tissue origin.

codeList: Cell line - derived from xenograft tumour
Metastatic tumour - metastasis local to lymph node
Metastatic tumour - metastasis to distant location
Normal - tissue adjacent to primary tumour
Xenograft - derived from tumour cell line

left.description: Indicate the cause of a donor's death.
left.name: cause_of_death

meta.notes: Cause of death is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

right.description: Indicate the cause of a donor's death.
right.name: cause_of_death

meta.notes: Cause of death is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

left.description: Interval of how long the donor has survived since primary diagnosis, in days.
left.name: survival_time

meta.notes: Survival_time is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

right.description: Interval of how long the donor has survived since primary diagnosis, in days.
right.name: survival_time

meta.notes: Survival_time is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

left.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: pathological_stage_group
left.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on pathological_tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

right.name: pathological_stage_group
right.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on pathological_tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

left.name: tumour_grade
left.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected tumour_grading_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Grading Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-grading-classifications

right.name: tumour_grade
right.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected tumour_grading_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Grading Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-grading-classifications

left.name: clinical_tumour_staging_system
left.description: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of primary diagnosis (prior to treatment).

right.name: clinical_tumour_staging_system
right.description: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of primary diagnosis (prior to treatment).

left.name: clinical_stage_group
left.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

right.name: clinical_stage_group
right.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

left.name: treatment_intent
left.description: Indicate the intended disease outcome for which the treatment is given. (Reference: CDISC [NCIt code: C124307])

data.name: treatment_intent
data.description: Indicate the intended disease outcome for which the treatment is given. (Reference: CDISC [NCIt code: C124307])

left.name: treatment_setting
left.description: Indicate the treatment setting, which describes the treatment's purpose in relation to the primary treatment. (Reference: CDISC [NCIt code: C124308])

data.name: treatment_setting
data.description: Indicate the treatment setting, which describes the treatment's purpose in relation to the primary treatment. (Reference: CDISC [NCIt code: C124308])

left.name: response_to_treatment
left.description: The donor's response to the applied treatment regimen. (Source: RECIST)

data.name: response_to_treatment
data.description: The donor's response to the applied treatment regimen. (Source: RECIST)

left.name: outcome_of_treatment
left.description: Indicate the donor's outcome of the prescribed treatment.

codeList: Treatment incomplete due to technical or organizational problems
Treatment stopped due to lack of efficacy (disease progression)
Treatment stopped due to acute toxicity

data.name: outcome_of_treatment
data.description: Indicate the donor's outcome of the prescribed treatment.

codeList: Treatment incomplete due to technical or organizational problems
Treatment stopped due to lack of efficacy (disease progression)
Treatment stopped due to acute toxicity

left.name: clinical_trial_number
left.description: Based on the clinical_trial_database, indicate the unique NCT or EudraCT clinical trial identifier of which the donor is a participant.

right.name: clinical_trial_number
right.description: Based on the clinical_trial_database, indicate the unique NCT or EudraCT clinical trial identifier of which the donor is a participant.

left.description: Indicate the donor's relapse type.
left.name: relapse_type

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

right.description: Indicate the donor's relapse type.
right.name: relapse_type

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

left.description: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
left.name: relapse_interval

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

right.description: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
right.name: relapse_interval

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

left.description: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression or relapse or recurrence disease status. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 6161031)
left.name: method_of_progression_status

codeList: Biomarker in liquid biopsy (e.g. tumour marker in blood or urine)

meta.notes:
This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

right.description: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression or relapse or recurrence disease status. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 6161031)
right.name: method_of_progression_status

codeList: Biomarker in liquid biopsy (e.g. tumour marker in blood or urine)

meta.notes:
This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

left.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site where disease progression, relapse or recurrence occurred, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
left.name: anatomic_site_progression_or_recurrences

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

right.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site where disease progression, relapse or recurrence occurred, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
right.name: anatomic_site_progression_or_recurrences

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at time of retreatment for recurrence or disease progression. This may be represented as rTNM in the medical report.
left.name: recurrence_tumour_staging_system

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at time of retreatment for recurrence or disease progression. This may be represented as rTNM in the medical report.
right.name: recurrence_tumour_staging_system

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

left.name: recurrence_stage_group
left.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression.

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

right.name: recurrence_stage_group
right.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression.

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery. This may be represented as ypTNM or ycTNM in the medical report.
left.name: posttherapy_tumour_staging_system

right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery. This may be represented as ypTNM or ycTNM in the medical report.
right.name: posttherapy_tumour_staging_system

left.name: posttherapy_stage_group
left.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting posttherapy_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

right.name: posttherapy_stage_group
right.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting posttherapy_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications
